about.description:
pandoc-plot turns code blocks present in your documents (Markdown, LaTeX, etc.)
into embedded figures, using your plotting toolkit of choice, including Matplotlib, ggplot2,
MATLAB, Mathematica, and more.
about.summary: Render and include figures in Pandoc documents using your plotting toolkit of choice

pandoc-plot turns code blocks present in your documents (Markdown, LaTeX, etc.)
into embedded figures, using your plotting toolkit of choice, including Matplotlib, ggplot2,
MATLAB, Mathematica, and more.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pandoc-plot" %}
{% set version = "0.9.3.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/LaurentRDC/{{ name }}/releases/download/{{ version }}/pandoc-plot-windows-x86_64.zip  # [win]
  sha256: 511cb1e28fb30d058f6df18c47262ecdae1069f14a69e175028787502b961f77  # [win]

  url: https://github.com/LaurentRDC/{{ name }}/releases/download/{{ version }}/pandoc-plot-linux-x86_64-static.tar.xz  # [linux64]
  sha256: 294a134fa87b9ce4ba521f09238691a0090681b112bdce32e557c84dd3f95497  # [linux64]

  url: https://github.com/LaurentRDC/{{ name }}/releases/download/{{ version }}/pandoc-plot-macos-x86_64.tar.xz  # [osx]
  sha256: 9a4f0ecd5cad5ad2ae64524a14c48d1590442fbe50a016746dfa9012ba8ff465  # [osx]

build:
  number: 0

requirements:
  run:
    - pandoc >=2.10,<2.11

test:
  commands:
    - pandoc-plot --version
    - pandoc-plot --help

about:
  home: https://github.com/LaurentRDC/pandoc-plot
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Render and include figures in Pandoc documents using your plotting toolkit of choice
  description: |
    pandoc-plot turns code blocks present in your documents (Markdown, LaTeX, etc.) 
    into embedded figures, using your plotting toolkit of choice, including Matplotlib, ggplot2, 
    MATLAB, Mathematica, and more.
  doc_url: https://github.com/LaurentRDC/pandoc-plot/
  dev_url: https://github.com/LaurentRDC/pandoc-plot/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - LaurentRDC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
